content: What body of water separates the United Kingdom from mainland Europe?

The English Channel separates the United Kingdom from mainland Europe. It is a body of water that lies between southern England and northern France. The channel is approximately 350 miles (560 kilometers) long and varies in width from about 21 miles (34 kilometers) at its narrowest point to over 100 miles (160 kilometers) at its widest. It has been an important maritime route for centuries and is known for its strong tides and sometimes rough waters.
